title.rendered: Get the Necessary Treatments of Urological Diseases by a Urologist in West Delhi

content.rendered:
Urology is the branch of medical science that deals with the diseases of the male and female urinary tract system and male reproductive organs. Urological conditions can be surgical as well as medicinal. The organs that fall under the branch of urology are kidneys, adrenal glands, ureter, urinary bladders, urethra, the male reproductive organs (testes, epididymis, vas deferens, seminal vesicles, prostate, and the penis.).The surgeons or doctors who treat urological disorders are called urologists. If you think you have any chances of getting any of them then you should visit a urologist in west Delhi.

What is the relationship between reproductive organs and the urological tract?

The location of the reproductive organs and urinary organs are very close to each other. So, when there’s a problem in either system, it affects the other system as well. As a result, a significant portion of these conditions which exists in urology falls under the category genitourinary disorders

Some Common Urological Diseases:
  • Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH): BPH or Being Prostatic Hyperplasia in the enlargement of the prostate. It increases the size of the prostate gland and it is more common in older men. The basic symptoms are frequent urination, weak stream of urine so they feel that the bladder is not empty. So, it is important to visit the dr who may just prescribe alpha-blockers. In extreme cases, they may opt for surgery.
  • Urinary Incontinence: It is the disorder when people lost control of their bladders. Urinary Incontinence results in leakage of urine anytime, anywhere. The common factors that cause it are diabetes, pregnancy, childbirth, overactive bladder, urinary tract infections, constipation, etc. Urinary incontinence can be controlled with the simplest measures like cutting down the intake of fluids. If the case is severe, you might need to do a surgery.
  • Urinary Tract Infections (UTI): Urinary Tract Infection is a bacterial or viral infection. It happens when certain pathogens like virus or bacteria invade the urinary tract. UTIs occur both in men and women but it is more common in women. Doctors usually prescribe antibiotics to clear them.
  • Kidney and bladder stones: Kidney and bladder stones are perhaps the most common urological disorders. It happens due to the crystallization of small articles in the urine. When these crystals move from the kidney to the bladder, you get bladder stones. It usually requires surgery to remove the stones or some advanced medical procedures like Extra corporeal shock wave lithotripsy (ESWL).

These are the most common form of urological diseases. Visit organ Hospital to get the required treatment for such problems. They use advanced medical procedures and the bills won’t come out large. It is the best private hospital in West Delhi.
